required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of IgM in Covid-19 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: The Prognostic Value of IgM in Covid-19 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the research is to study the relation between the presence and /or the anti SARS-Co-V-2 IgM level in an early stage of COVID-19 infection, and the evolution of the illness.

detailed_description.textblock: The secondary objective is to determinate in what manner response of IgM anti-SARS-Co-V-2 relates to patient's immunity statute, in regards to the other so-called humain "seasonal coronavirus".

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Absence of hospitalization versus hospitalization without ventilation during SARS-CoV-2 infection

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Non ventilation versus ventilation during Covid-19 hospitalization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization at Ambroise Paré hospital during SARS-CoV-2 infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
through study completion, an average of 1 month
through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Thoracic CT result during SARS-CoV-2 infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Death of hospitalized patients in Ambroise Paré hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 month

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood sampling between day 1 to day 14 from first syndromes of Covid-19 infection. Serum or plasma conservations.

study_pop.textblock: Adult SARS-CoV-2 positive patients who have blood sampling between 1 day and 14 days from the first clinical syndromes and their collections of serum or plasma are accessible.

overall_official.affiliation: Microbiological Laboratory - CHU Ambroise Paré - APHP
